file_insights.purpose: Creates and configures Emotion CSS-in-JS cache with RTL language support

patterns_discovered.pattern: Conditional Configuration Based on Text Direction
patterns_discovered.description: Function branches logic based on direction parameter to apply different stylis plugins
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: RTL direction includes both prefixer and rtlPlugin; LTR uses only prefixer

patterns_discovered.description: Emotion cache configured with multiple stylis plugins for CSS transformation
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: stylisPlugins array allows stacking prefixer and rtl plugins for comprehensive CSS handling

patterns_discovered.description: Direction-specific cache keys distinguish RTL and LTR configurations
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Keys use 'muirtl' for RTL and 'muiltr' for LTR, suggesting Material-UI convention

patterns_discovered.description: Well-documented JSDoc comments explaining purpose and parameters
patterns_discovered.implementation_detail: Clear documentation of RTL behavior and cache key distinction

gotchas_discovered.description: RTL support requires explicit import and conditional application of stylis-plugin-rtl
gotchas_discovered.impact: Missing plugin import or incorrect plugin application will silently fail to convert CSS properties for RTL layouts
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Plugin is explicitly imported and conditionally applied only when direction is 'rtl'

gotchas_discovered.description: The order of plugins in stylisPlugins array affects CSS transformation pipeline
gotchas_discovered.impact: Incorrect plugin ordering could result in CSS not being properly prefixed or RTL-converted
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Current implementation uses [prefixer, rtlPlugin] order, which appears intentional for proper transformation sequence

gotchas_discovered.description: Different cache keys ('muirtl' vs 'muiltr') prevent cache collision but require consistent key usage across application
gotchas_discovered.impact: If consuming code uses wrong cache key or creates its own cache, direction-specific styles may not apply correctly
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Export function ensures consistent cache creation wherever needed in the application

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully implemented Emotion cache factory function with RTL plugin support
key_accomplishments: Created direction-aware cache factory supporting both LTR and RTL text directions
Integrated stylis-plugin-rtl for automatic CSS property conversion for right-to-left languages
Implemented conditional plugin composition to optimize for each text direction
Added comprehensive JSDoc documentation explaining RTL behavior and usage

recommendations.recommendation: Create corresponding useEmotionCache hook or integration point that leverages this factory based on application language/direction state
recommendations.rationale: Factory function needs to be integrated into Material-UI CacheProvider for actual runtime usage

recommendations.recommendation: Add unit tests verifying correct stylis plugins are applied for each direction
recommendations.rationale: CSS transformation correctness is critical and should be verified through testing

recommendations.recommendation: Create documentation explaining how to use this cache with Material-UI CacheProvider and ThemeProvider
recommendations.rationale: Factory function requires proper consumer integration for RTL support to be effective

recommendations.recommendation: Consider caching cache instances (e.g., memoizing createEmotionCache results) if called multiple times during application lifecycle
recommendations.rationale: Emotion cache creation is relatively lightweight but could be optimized if instantiated repeatedly

recommendations.recommendation: Add type definitions for the returned Emotion cache object to improve IDE autocomplete and type safety
recommendations.rationale: Return type could be explicitly typed for better developer experience
